title: Improve examples, particularly animation related examples

content.raw:
The current examples are very minimalist and some CMakeLists.txt don't even build their examples because they are missing additional dependencies and have incorrect variable names. 

I'v creating an improved stand alone animation example and fixing a number of problems in other examples.


The context of this issue has changed since I worked around animate_pose. Here is the old information:

I'm attempting to run the animate_pose example. The file in the tree is out of date, so I updated it with the version from the website, then ran gzsdf on that. I also built the example but had to fix the CMakeLists.txt. 

I will create a branch and pull request with those changes once I have the issue number. 

The commit I based my changes off of is : 399a916b9ae4

Once I got it compiling I attempted to run it as detailed below on OS X 10.9 and got an error: 

```
#!bash


○ gazebo /Users/ahundt/source/hg/simulate/examples/plugins/animate_pose/animate_pose.world --verbose
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 3.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2014 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 3.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2014 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.24.1.83
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.24.1.83
2014-03-19 14:31:07.576 gzserver[28159:507] invalid drawable
2014-03-19 14:31:08.082 gzclient[28160:507] invalid drawable
2014-03-19 14:31:09.845 gzclient[28160:507] invalid drawable
```

Here is a pull request including the changes:


#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1023/update-animate_poseworld-and-cmakeliststxt/diff


How do I fix the "invalid drawable" errors?
content.html:
The current examples are very minimalist and some CMakeLists.txt don't even build their examples because they are missing additional dependencies and have incorrect variable names.

I'v creating an improved stand alone animation example and fixing a number of problems in other examples.

The context of this issue has changed since I worked around animate_pose. Here is the old information:

I'm attempting to run the animate_pose example. The file in the tree is out of date, so I updated it with the version from the website, then ran gzsdf on that. I also built the example but had to fix the CMakeLists.txt.

I will create a branch and pull request with those changes once I have the issue number.

The commit I based my changes off of is : 399a916b9ae4

Once I got it compiling I attempted to run it as detailed below on OS X 10.9 and got an error: 

○ gazebo /Users/ahundt/source/hg/simulate/examples/plugins/animate_pose/animate_pose.world --verbose

http://gazebosim.org

Here is a pull request including the changes:

#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1023/update-animate_poseworld-and-cmakeliststxt/diff

How do I fix the "invalid drawable" errors?
